results.title: The Medicine bottle
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: An inadvertent mistake with potentially disastrous consequences is made when Mrs Ross leaves the wrong medicine in the hands of her young daughter who is at home looking Mrs Ross’ bed-ridden mother. Cast includes Florence Lawrence, Adele DeGarde, Marion Leonard, Linda Arvidson. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Media between us
results.brief_description: A film record of the 1968 Summer Research Institute of Screen Study, a joint project of the National Film Board and McGill University. Thirty teachers from across Canada attending a six-week course in film production and analysis are observed by a documentary film crew. Many of their discussions centre on the impact of technology and media on the individual and the environment.

results.title: The Mechanism of Life
results.creator_credit: Eiji Murayama, Sakura Motion Pictures and Masami Sugiyama
results.brief_description: Shows how biochemists study cellular life. Experiments are shown to support the theory of evolution of life from the four elements, carbon, hydrogen, oxygen and nitrogen. The methods used to study muscle protein and insulin are also shown.

results.title: The Mechanical paradise
results.creator_credit: Lorna Pegram, David Richardson, RM Productions, Time-Life Films and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Shock of the New Series”.
This opening episode, of an 8-part series, covers the blend of art and industry, and shows how a growing belief in technology and the machine heralded the arrival of modernity. The Eiffel Tower in Paris, designed by an engineer not an architect, established the cult of dynamism, spread through railway stations, by automobile and the increasing advances in technology. The Cubists put onto canvas what is visually interpreted. Picasso and Braque’s influence by African carving distortions modified relationships and thought, and led to collage using industrial items and household objects incorporated on the canvas. Delaunay’s light through structure, Apollinaire’s poetry, Marinetti, Duchamp and Picabia blended all forms of artistic expression at once.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lorna Pegram, David Richardson, RM Productions, Time-Life Films and BBC-TV

results.title: The Mechanical knee
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Jean Roy and Claudia Overing
results.brief_description: The account of a young secretary, Gail Tremblay, who is threatened by a giant cell tumor of the leg. Faced with three alternatives (amputation, fusion of the knee joint, or an experimental prosthesis), she chooses the mechanical knee. The film shows the various stages of the procedure: the construction of a hinged metal joint; in the operating room, the surgery to excise the affected area and insert the mechanical knee; and the physiotherapy that enabled her to return to work and a reasonably active life. (Award: Varna)

results.title: The Meaning of the industrial revolution
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Shows scenes in a rural village in Britain, thatching, cobbling, blacksmithing and a home workshop for spinning and weaving to illustrate the early use of hand tools and the domestic system. The film then describes briefly the inventions which fostered the growth of the factory system; the change-over to steam-power; the new process for refining iron ore. The film states common problems of industry today.

results.title: The Meaning of Feudalism
results.brief_description: A modern French village is used to show the characteristics of the feudal system and the importance of the castle, church and pastoral lands during these times. Details of the construction of castles are used to explain the purposes served by the more important parts of the castle such as the moat, the drawbridge, the courtyard, stables for horses, wells for water, the big tower or donjon and the thick outer and inner walls. Tapestries in castles show scenes depicting hunting, chivalry, knights and nobles. The function of the church and the responsibility of abbots and bishops in caring for the land are explained. Models and sketches illustrate the organization of the feudal manor and show how traces of the feudal system are still to be found in Modern France.

results.title: The Meaning of democracy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Building Political Leadership”.
Dr. E E Schattschneider explains the meaning of democracy. Democracy, in his view, is a way of living justly with other people. It is a search for justice and truth. The American Bill of Rights and the system of justice are also discussed.

results.title: The Meaning of adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
Describes the status of the adolescent , in relation to the social, emotional, mental and physical changes occurring in the years between childhood and adulthood. Points out that adults, through proper understanding, can help the teenager adjust to aspects of adult life.

results.title: The Meadow ant
results.brief_description: Explains where the meadow ants are found, and traces the lifecycle of the meadow ant: the nest-making, feeding, and mating. The film then describes the structure, classifies the different types of ant and deals comprehensively with their highly organised communities.
